Priyanka Chopra to Arjun Kapoor: Actors who shared important insi...

Priyanka Chopra to Arjun Kapoor: Actors who shared important insights to keep in mind while battling Coronavirus

TIMESOFINDIA.COM | Last updated on - Mar 18, 2020, 14:58 ISTShare fbsharetwsharepinshareComments (0)

    close

01/7​Priyanka Chopra to Arjun Kapoor: Actors who shared important insights to keep in mind while battling Coronavirus

Due to the severe outbreak of COVID-19, government officials around the world have been taking necessary precautions to try and bring the situation under control. Public places like parks, theatres, swimming pools, shopping malls are already shut until March 31. Also, the entertainment industry has been locked down for the next few days. B-town celebrities have been urging fans on social media to stay safe. Many actors are sharing important insights to keep in mind while battling Coronavirus. From Priyanka Chopra, Arjun Kapoor, Parineeti Chopra to Varun Dhawan, here's what actors have to say apart from taking precautionary measures.

readmore

02/7​Priyanka Chopra addresses COVID-19 rumours

There is a lot of information being bombarded about COVID-19 on the internet. However, everything being shared is not true, therefore to raise this awareness Priyanka Chopra took to Twitter and urged her followers to trust UNICEF and shared, “Misinformation during a health crisis can leave us unprotected, spread fear & panic. Knowing the facts is key to protecting yourself & your family. Visit the @UNICEF website for reliable information on how to talk to children about #coronavirus”.

readmore

03/7​Parineeti Chopra's note for doctors and medical staff

Recently, Parineeti Chopra took to her Instagram to share an informative post related to the coronavirus scare. She penned down a note to thank the doctors and other medical staff around the world who are risking their lives to save people.''While all of us have the ''luxury'' to be house arrested and waiting for news- please spare a thought for the doctors and the medical staff around the world who are risking their lives, away from their families, to save us! Exactly like our soldiers to at a war. Thank you guys, we will NEVER, EVER be able to repay you", she wrote.

readmore

04/7​Richa Chadha's request to bail out small businesses

The lockdown decision of the government is highly affecting small businesses and daily wage workers. Expressing their concern and taking a stand for them actress Richa Chadha took to Twitter to mention, "Dear government, Please announce a bailout for the small businesses... or this lockdown will be the last nail in their coffin, Announce relief/daily wage workers. We’re staring a disaster in the face! Politics can wait. #SaveIndiaFromCOVID19 Link: https://twitter.com/hashtag/SaveIndiaFromCOVID19?src=hashtag_click "

readmore

05/7Sonakshi Sinha's concern for home and office workers

Sonakshi Sinha has been consistently spreading awareness on the subject, from emphasizing the importance of sanitizers to wearing masks and social distancing. She also recently took to Instagram stories to share an important message of looking after the needs of the house and office workers. She took to her Insta stories to write, "In this time when we're taking every precaution for your safety and your family's safety let's not forget about the safety of our house help, home and office staff...please don't send out your house helps, drivers, to run errands on your behalf or send them in crowded places what you think is not safe for you is not safe for them either. Kindly be considerate towards them."

readmore

06/7​Arjun Kapoor's stern advice for paps

Amid coronavirus outbreak, Arjun wrote a long note for paparazzi on social media. The actor has requested paparazzi to be 'sensitive and sensible'. Yesterday, when Arjun visited his doctor's clinic, the paps followed him and started clicking pictures. The actor didn’t pose for photos instead, he asked the paps to go home and rest. Later he penned a note which read, “I love my job and am okay with the attention media gives but genuinely I don't believe now is the time for us to be normal and just pose of images getting in and out of trying to maintain a sane life.” Adding, “Short term distance is better for long term proximity that everyone enjoys...Stay healthy and stay home.”

readmore

07/7​Varun Dhawan's hard-hitting message

Recently, Varun Dhawan took to his Instagram to share a hard-hitting message where he said that development is important but not at the cost of killing other species. The actor shared a picture of mother earth wearing a mask and wrote, "As we all battle this virus. I think it is time we realise that the human race has been extremely selfish. It’s time we introspect. We share this planet with many other species. Development is important but not at the cost of killing other species. We will overcome this but we must realise that messing with Mother Nature comes at a cost."

readmore
